thread.section_title: Central Florida Political Pulse - Orlando Sentinel
thread.title: Fox 35: Paul Paulson charity for veterans lists cell phone as suicide hotline
thread.title_full: Fox 35: Paul Paulson charity for veterans lists cell phone as suicide hotline

author: Jeff Weiner
title: Fox 35: Paul Paulson charity for veterans lists cell phone as suicide hotline
text:
Political Pulse Your political and regional news source Fox 35: Paul Paulson charity for veterans lists cell phone as suicide hotline Orlando mayoral candidates interview with Editorial Board 
Full Editorial Board interview with Orlando mayoral candidates Buddy Dyer, Paul Paulson and Linda Marie "Sunshine" Grund. 
Full Editorial Board interview with Orlando mayoral candidates Buddy Dyer, Paul Paulson and Linda Marie "Sunshine" Grund. Jeff Weiner Contact Reporter Fox 35: Paul Paulson vets charity lists cell phone as suicide line 
The website for Orlando mayoral candidate Paul Paulson's veterans charity, Help the Vets, lists his personal cell phone as a suicide hotline, according to a report by Orlando Sentinel news partner Fox 35 . 
The same mobile phone number is identified on the charity's website as a "24 hour veterans suicide referral hotline," and on the Paulson campaign's site as his "personal cell phone," the report noted. 
"I get called at two in the morning, three in the morning on occasion, once or twice a month it happens, and those are people in need," Paulson told Fox 35. "People that may be intoxicated and drunk, they need somebody to talk to [and] we try and deal with them as they are." 
By comparison, a United Way representative told Fox 35 that its suicide line is staffed by at least two people at all times, with no less than 80 hours of training. Paulson defended his own qualifications. 
"I also have a B.A. in psychology with an emphasis on counseling," he said. "I went to graduate school and studied psychology back in the '70s and I’ve kept up on what’s going on."
